summary:
this is the book "inside hbo's game of thrones seasons 1 & 2" and look what i've founded:
"Rory McCann as Sandor Clegane, or The...
body:
this is the book “inside hbo’s game of thrones seasons 1 & 2” and look what i’ve founded:

“Rory McCann as Sandor Clegane, or The Hound, the unmerciful Joffrey’s personal bodyguard that has a felling for his sovereign’s fiancee, Sansa Stark”

it’s a shame that they are trying to erase sansan like it never happend tho :/

summary:
I love the Daenerys and Sansa interaction in the winterfell library for so many reasons because it confirms so many things: 
-...
body:
I love the Daenerys and Sansa interaction in the winterfell library for so many reasons because it confirms so many things:

- Sansa doesn’t like dany not because of petty reasons like being jealous and threatened by her beauty (I mean we been knew but whatever). Nor is it because of her supposed feelings for Jon

- it is literally because Daenerys is an invader come to take their home and their independence. Her reasons for not liking dany are completely valid.

- Sansa says “We said we’d never bow to anyone else again”, not “I”, because it’s not just her, it’s the whole north that feels that way. She isn’t being selfish, she isn’t putting herself first, she’s putting her people first

- in contrast, Dany’s reasons for being there are entirely selfish. She’s there only because she’s in love with Jon, not because she cares about the lives of the people she wants to call her queen

- Sansa does not give a shit if you shower her with flattery and try to play nice with her. She’ll see right through it and never lose sight of her goal. Shes too smart, too determined, and not so easily manipulated

- dany isn’t a “breaker of chains”. When she’s speaking to Sansa and she’s confronted with the fact that her rule is unwanted, there is a look of absolute fury on her face. She has no interest in letting the north have its independence which it has fought so hard for, she freed people only when it was beneficial for her to. She isn’t becoming a tyrant, she already is one

- Sansa and Daenerys are incompatible and opposites in every way that counts. Sansa wants independence, dany wants to take that away; Sansa is the most shrewd player in the game, constantly planning ahead, and dany is incapable of planning beyond the next day; Sansa cares about what the people want, dany couldn’t care less; Sansa is calm and logical, dany is ruled by her murderous impulses. They are fundamentally opposed in politics, character and temperament. (I am genuinely shocked there are people out here shipping this trash after this scene, or think it was romantic. Did all of this really go over your head???)

This scene is a snap shot of their entire respective character arcs and displays exactly why Sansa will be a just queen and Daenerys a tyrannical dictator.

summary: I think that deep down Dany does know that she's an incompetent leader compared to Sansa. She laughed about Jon manipulating her...
question: I think that deep down Dany does know that she's an incompetent leader compared to Sansa. She laughed about Jon manipulating her to fighting for the North like it was a big joke, but she must have felt embarrassed that she was so impulsive and (lbr) sex-crazed. Not exactly spectacular queen behavior. She knows that she brings nothing to the table beyond her dragons, and even they aren't much. Sansa has loyal allies, resources, brains, and more. She can't compete in the end.
answer:
Hi!

I’m not sure if she knows this, tbh. Her level of arrogance and hypocrisy is outstanding the last 2 seasons. Most notably, when she asks Jon to honor the pledge his ancestors made for fear of their lives to Aegon and in the same breath accused Jon of his father’s friend’s choices and asks that she not be judged by her father’s sin all in the same scene.

I really don’t think she has enough self awareness at the moment to truly look back and reflect on her style of ruling compared to others because she simply believes her rule is the best. Her ambitions are so close to being fulfilled and I really don’t see her being able to acknowledge this fact until it is too late and she becomes the stigma of her name she so desperately wished to break away from. There was something tragic in her conversation with Barristan when he brought up the Mad King and in a low voice and a tone more to herself than him says “I’m not my father.” She wants the glory of House Targaryen but none of the dangers that are presented when evoking inner strength from such a legacy. With Jon though, he posed no threat to her. He was just a bastard who bent the knee and already gave away his kingdom to her. He was essentially her pet who was ever so devoted and loved her. It was like another Daario expect a more special version. It’s why I think she was so confident to urge he mount her dragons and went to war with him. (Well, at the small fee of the sovereignty of the North) but she seemed so oblivious in her conversation with Sansa when she remarks of who has been manipulating whom. She didn’t even catch on to the implications of this statement and only chuckles along with Sansa.

But I do think she’s noticing more and more the people that surround Sansa and how Sansa is a woman who commands the respect and loyalty and more importantly, love. She’s never had to deal with a ruler who was loved. Hell, even more loved than she was.

summary:
Daenerys: Thank you for coming to my ai..
Theon 'turning to sansa instead': Sure my queen, whatever. I will fight for you Lady...
body:
Daenerys: Thank you for coming to my ai..
Theon 'turning to sansa instead': Sure my queen, whatever. I will fight for you Lady Sansa. I will die for you. I will literally take a knife in the chest for you. Just say the word.

summary: I'm still waiting for sansa and the hound to reunite :(
question: I'm still waiting for sansa and the hound to reunite :(
answer: Me too! The hound seeing a different Sansa from the one he remembers will be so interesting. And sansa giving him that bland dead smile of her’s, but with eyes speaking of gratitude. So far sansa’s reunions have been one of my favorite things, so I am seriously looking forwards to it. Let sansa live by the end of the season please, I can’t handle my best girl dying
